item.title: Melissa add a quote by Susan B. Anthony
item.description: "Let me tell you what I think of bicycling. I think it has done more to emancipate women than anything else in the world. It gives women a feeling of freedom and self-reliance. I stand and rejoice every time I see a woman ride by on a wheel…the picture of free, untrammeled womanhood." -- Susan B. Anthony

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Paul Valéry
item.description: "To see is to forget the name of the thing one sees." -- Paul Valéry

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Lucien Zell
item.description: "Your work is not what gives you your food, it's what gives you your hunger." -- Lucien Zell

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Paul Valéry
item.description: "The best way to make your dreams come true is to wake up." -- Paul Valéry

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "As long as there are slaughterhouses, there will be battlefields" -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Gloria Steinem
item.description: "The first problem for all of us, men and women, is not to learn but to unlearn." -- Gloria Steinem

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Elizabeth Taylor
item.description: "When people say: She's got everything. I've only one answer: I haven't had tomorrow." -- Elizabeth Taylor

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Edith Armstrong Talbot
item.description: "I keep the telephone of my mind open to peace, harmony, health, love and abundance. Then whenever doubt, anxiety, or fear try to call me, they keep getting a busy signal and soon they'll forget my number." -- Edith Armstrong Talbot

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Zelda Fitzgerald
item.description: "I dont' want to live - I want to love first, and live incidentally." -- Zelda Fitzgerald
